topic.title: Master Data Hub
topic.shortdesc: Shared content for Master Data Hub

dlentry.dd:
Sets the field to use as the input and output.
Deleted fields are shown as “Unknown” in red.
Adds the input/output and closes the dialog.
Closes the dialog without adding an input/output.

Selects the function category of which the function to be applied is a member. Follow the links to topics for information about the functions in each category:
DOC-1471 markup correctionString
DOC-1471 markup correctionNumeric
DOC-1471 markup correctionDate
Selects the function to be applied. The available selections are dependent upon the selected Category.

Opens a second dialog in which you define the function’s input parameters and/or output(s). The controls in the dialog are dependent upon the selected function in the Functions list. For some functions, a third dialog opens when you click OK in the second.
Closes the dialog without adding an input and output(s).
Selects AND or OR as the Boolean operator defining the relationship between the top-level conditions and condition groups.

section.title: Filter Sources
section.p:
Typing in this field filters the sources summary list below to include only sources having matching names. Clicking
clears the field and stops filtering.

section.title: Sources tabs in model and repository pages

dlentry.dd: Sets the URL template will use to construct target URLs for links, rendered in the Golden Records page, to entities in this source system. This setting is also in the Add a Source dialog and the Attach a Source dialog.

HUB-1333 insertionIf switched to Yes, multiple links are allowed from individual golden records to entities in the source system, and entities contributed from the source cannot be quarantined as potential duplicates. This switch is set to No by default. This setting is also in the Add a Source dialog and the Attach a Source dialog.

(Present only if this source can contribute data.)
This tab is used to configure handling of entity contributions from the source. Its controls are identical to those in the Inbound tab in the Add a Source dialog and the Attach a Source dialog.

(Present only if this source can contribute data.)
This tab is used to configure handling of entity contributions from the source. Its controls are identical to those in the Outbound tab in the Add a Source dialog and the Attach a Source dialog.
Changes the source configuration and closes the dialog.
Closes the dialog without changing the source configuration.
This tab is used to configure handling of entity contributions from the source.
This tab is used to configure propagation of update requests on the source’s channel.

section.p: (Present only if this source can contribute data.)

image.alt: HUB-791 insertion, release profiling intentionally omittedInbound tab for configuring the handling of entity contributions from the source

section.title: Record-level Options
section.p: This section is used to configure golden record-level restrictions on entity contributions.

dlentry.dd:
If selected, new entity contributions from the source are automatically quarantined subject to an optionally specified rule. An entity quarantined for this reason cannot not be incorporated into the domain unless manually approved.
If a rule is not configured, all new entity contributions are quarantined.
If a rule is configured, a contributed entity is quarantined only if it satisfies the specified rule.
Selecting this check box reveals the following control:
Add a rule — Reveals the controls for configuring the rule.
The following controls are used to configure the rule:
The field chooser is used to select the field whose value is to be evaluated against the specified static value.
The adjacent list is used to select the comparison operator. These operators are available for selection:
is equal to
is not equal to
is less than
is less than or equal to
is greater than
is greater than or equal to
contains
does not contain
starts with
The next field is used to set the static value to be evaluated against the value of the selected field. If a reference field is selected, matching can occur only with an actual value — the ID of a referenced golden record.
OK — Saves the rule (but not the source configuration).
Cancel — Cancels configuration of the rule.
The following controls are applicable to an existing rule:
Edit — Reveals the controls for modifying the rule.
Remove — Deletes the rule.
HUB-1257 updateThe following button is revealed for configuring an individual rule:
Advanced Configuration — Opens the Configure Business Rule dialog which is used to specify complex rules.
Configure Business Rule dialog
Name Description
Inputs This section is used to define the rule’s inputs and their corresponding outputs.
Name Description
Add Selects the type of input to add to the rule.
Field — Opens the Add a Field dialog, which is used to add a single field as both an input and output.
Add a Field dialog
Name Description
Field Sets the field to use as the input and output.
Deleted fields are shown as “Unknown” in red.
Clicking
clears both Field and Alias.
Alias Sets an output alias for the selected Field. Outputs are referenced by alias in the Conditions and Error Message sections. Alias is automatically populated with the field name upon selection of a Field and cleared upon the clearing of Field.
OK Adds the input/output and closes the dialog.
Cancel Closes the dialog without adding an input/output.
Function — Opens the Add a Function dialog, the first of a series of two or more dialogs, which are used to add a function input and the corresponding output(s).
Add a Function dialog
Name Description
Inputs list Lists the inputs defined for the rule and provides controls for deleting them. In the list:
Clicking the name of an input opens the Add A Field dialog or the Add a Function dialog for the purpose of modifying the output(s).
Clicking
for an input initiates a request to delete it. In the confirmation dialog:
Clicking OK executes the request.
Clicking Cancel cancels the request.
Conditions This section is used to define the conditions for the rule.
Name Description
Top Level Operator Selects AND or OR as the Boolean operator defining the relationship between the top-level conditions and condition groups.
Conditions list Lists the conditions defined for the rule and provides controls for adding, modifying, deleting and reordering conditions and condition groups. Indentation delineates levels in the hierarchy.
At each level of the hierarchy the following links are available:
Links for adding a condition or condition group
Add a Condition — Add a list entry for a new condition at the current level in the hierarchy.
Add a Group — Add a list entry for a new condition group at the current level in the hierarchy.
You must save changes to individual conditions and condition groups to add them.
For each condition and condition group the following links and controls are available:
Links and controls for each condition and condition group
reorder icon — Used to change the position of the condition or condition group by dragging and dropping.
Edit — Reveals controls used to edit the condition or condition group.
Remove — Removes the condition or condition group. Removing a condition group removes all of its member conditions.
The following links and controls are revealed when Edit is clicked for either a condition or a condition group:
Save — Saves changes to the condition or condition group and hides the editing controls.
Cancel — Discards unsaved changes to the condition or condition group and hides the editing controls.
The following links and controls are additionally revealed when Edit is clicked for a condition:
Links and controls that are additionally revealed when Edit is clicked for a condition
Output selection lists — Select Static or one of the outputs. Outputs are referenced by alias. Multiple outputs for a given input are indented in the list below the input alias. Selecting Static reveals a field to the right for specifying the static value.
Static value fields
Operator selection list — Sets the manner in which two specified outputs are compared or a single specified output is evaluated. The operators contains, does not contain, starts with, is empty, and is not empty perform string comparisons. They should not be used for numeric comparisons.
= Output #1 to the left equals output #2 to the right.
!= Output #1 is not equal to output #2.
< Output #1 is less than output #2.
> Output #1 is greater than output #2.
<= Output #1 is less than or equal to output #2.
>= Output #1 is greater than or equal to output #2.
contains Output #1 contains output #2.
does not contain Output #1 does not contain output #2.
starts with Output #1 starts with output #2.
is empty Output #1 is null.
is not empty Output #1 is not null.
The following control is additionally revealed when Edit is clicked for a condition group:
Control that is additionally revealed when Edit is clicked for a condition group
Group Level Operator — Selects AND or OR as the Boolean operator defining the relationship between the condition group’s member conditions and condition groups.
Save Closes the dialog and restores focus to the source configuration dialog. At this point clicking OK saves the rule (but not the source configuration).
Cancel Closes the dialog and restores focus to the source configuration dialog, effectively discarding the rule definition.

dt.uicontrol: Require approval for updates to any field

dlentry.dd:
If selected, entity contributions from the source that would update golden records are automatically quarantined subject to an optionally specified rule. An entity quarantined for this reason cannot not be incorporated into the domain unless manually approved.
If a rule is not configured, all entity contributions that would update golden records are quarantined.
If a rule is configured, a contributed entity is quarantined only if it satisfies the specified rule.
Selecting this check box reveals the following control:
Add a rule — Reveals the controls for configuring the rule.
The controls for configuring the rule are identical to those described above for requiring approval for new entity contributions.
The following controls are applicable to an existing rule:
Edit — Reveals the controls for modifying the rule.
Remove — Deletes the rule.

If selected, entity contributions from the source that would end-date matching golden records are automatically quarantined. An entity quarantined for this reason cannot be incorporated into the domain unless manually approved.

section.title: Field-level Options
section.p: This section is used to configure field-level restrictions on entity contributions. In this section the model’s fields are listed. Field groups are listed in bold. For each field or field group the radio buttons for selection are as follows except as noted:

li.p: Include (default) — Selects the field or collection for inclusion in create and update operations on golden records resulting from entity contributions.
Excluded — Selects the field for exclusion from create and update operations on golden records resulting from entity contributions.

Excluded fields are evaluated when match rules and data quality steps are applied. On the other hand, excluded fields are not evaluated against golden record content to identify changed fields and are removed from contributed entities prior to field validation.
Collection key fields in repeatable field groups are not available for selection.

Require approval for updates — Selects the field or collection as requiring manual approval for golden record updates. Collection fields within repeatable field groups are not available for selection, but the owning collections are selectable.

Custom — Selects the field for rule-based restrictions. One rule of each of type is allowed. One type is for excluding the field from create and update operations resulting from entity contributions from the source. The other type is for requiring manual approval for golden record updates.
Selecting Custom or clicking Show Rules reveals existing rules and the controls for adding, modifying, and deleting rules. Clicking Hide Rules hides existing rules.
In the controls for configuring an individual rule, the topmost list is used to select the type of rule to configure:
Exclude if — excluding the field from create and update operations on golden records resulting from entity contributions from the source.
Require approval if — requiring manual approval for the field or collection in golden record updates.
The remaining controls for configuring a rule are identical to those described above for requiring approval for new entity contributions.
The following link is available while a rule of one type (but not both types) exists:
Add a rule — Reveals the controls for configuring a rule of the type not already configured.
The following controls are applicable to an existing rule:
Edit — Reveals the controls for modifying the rule.
Remove — Deletes the rule.

section.p: (Present only if this source can accept channel updates.)

image.alt: Outbound tab for configuring propagation of update requests on the source’s channel

dlentry.dd:
Sets the manner in which record update requests are propagated to the source on its channel:
All Fields — Requests contain all fields in the golden record. This is the default.
Changed Fields Only — Requests include only the fields whose values were changed.

section.title: Record-level Options
section.p: This section is used to configure record-level restrictions on record update request propagation.

dt.uicontrol: Send all records to this source

dlentry.dd: If selected (this is the default), propagation of record update requests on the source’s channel is not subject to restriction.

dt.uicontrol: Apply rules to the sending of records to this source

dlentry.dd:
If selected, propagation of record update requests on the source’s channel is subject to the restriction configured immediately below. The controls for configuring the restriction are visible only while this option is selected.
Name Description
Send records to this source if they have any of these tags: If selected, record update requests are propagated on the source’s channel only for golden records having any of the selected tags. While this option is selected, check boxes appear below for selecting the tags.
Send new records to this source if they have any of these tags: If selected, record update requests specifying create operations are propagated on the source’s channel only for golden records having any of the selected tags — update requests specifying update and delete operations, on the other hand, are propagated without restriction. While this option is selected, check boxes appear below for selecting the tags.
Never send new records to this source If selected, record update requests specifying create operations are not propagated on the source’s channel.

section.title: Field-level Options
section.p: This section is used to configure field-level restrictions on record update request propagation. In this section the model’s fields are listed. Field groups are listed in bold. For each field or field group the radio buttons for selection are as follows except as noted:

li.p: Include (default) — Selects the field or collection for inclusion in record update requests.
Excluded — Selects the field or collection for exclusion from record update requests.
Collection key fields in repeatable field groups are not available for selection.

section.title: Notes
section.note: In the context of the REST APIs, a domain’s configuration and properties and the underlying model are collectively referred to as a universe.
HUB-1385 insertionEach link established from a golden record to a non-contributing source uses the golden record ID.
HUB-714 unrelated update, release profiling omittedNew accounts are limited to two repositories. Contact your account representative if you are interested in licensing additional repositories.
The following steps omit certain details that should be evident to users having experience using to DOC-1471 markup correctionbuild integration processes.

The quarantine entry remains in the list, even if the entity is successfully incorporated, until you close the detail view by clicking Close or clicking elsewhere in the Quarantine page. The list is then updated. If the entity was not incorporated, there will be a new quarantine entry for it.
Before you close the detail view, though, you can click
Previous and Next
to navigate to detail for other entries and individually resolve them.

Source rankings is a Tech Preview not intended for production use. Source rankings is an optional account feature. If you would like to have this feature enabled in your account, contact your representative.

HUB-714 unrelated update, release profiling omittedMDM Export Data is an optional account feature. The Export Records entitlement is valid only in accounts for which the feature is available. If you would like to have this feature enabled in your account, contact your account representative.

UNI-438 update, release profiling intentionally omitted*MDM* (exactly as shown here in uppercase with leading and trailing asterisks) is not a valid source ID because it is used to distinguish batches submitted manually in the service. If *MDM* is specified as the source ID, the response is an unknown source error.
Retrieval of the golden record is subject to access restrictions imposed by the authenticating user’s tag-based entitlements.
section.draft-comment: HUB-243 following note used starting in Jul2019
section.note: If you need to ensure each delivered batch is successfully routed to the source system before requesting delivery of the next batch, consider using the MDM connector’s manual acknowledgment option. If manual acknowledgment is enabled, the connector sets the dynamic process property mdm-current-delivery-id to the delivery ID of the most recently delivered batch. If you need to ensure no more than one update request is delivered per request, consider using the MDM connector’s option to fetch single update requests.

If you need to ensure each delivered batch is successfully routed to the source system before requesting delivery of the next batch, consider using the MDM connector’s manual acknowledgment option. If manual acknowledgment is enabled, the connector sets the dynamic process property mdm-current-delivery-id to the delivery ID of the most recently delivered batch.

HUB-1292 insertionIf the specified source is not attached to the universe but the universe has a designated default source and a golden record is linked to an entity with the specified ID in the default source system, the entity that corresponds to that golden record is retrieved.
DOC-173 insertion, release profiling intentionally omittedIt is not possible to move a field into a field group that represents a collection.

HUB-371 insertion, release profiling intentionally omittedDeleting pending update requests can prevent the synchronization of source system data and master data from occurring in certain circumstances, particularly in the case of requests of type Create Record.

HUB-1197 insertionWhen an entity quarantined with the cause “Update Approval Required” is resubmitted, if a golden record with the ID specified for linking does not exist, the repository performs normal matching, which in a normal case will result in creation of a golden record.

HUB-1290 insertion, release profiling intentionally omitted“Local” in this Hub Cloud’s name indicates geographically dispersed disaster recovery is not provided in order to support data sovereignty requirements. Data in this Hub Cloud remains exclusively in the AWS hosting region/country. This Hub Cloud does provide high availability via data replication within the hosting region.

HUB-1333 insertionExisting multiple links from individual golden records to a source’s entities persist if, after the source is configured to allow multiple links, the source is then reconfigured to disallow multiple links.

section.title: Definition list entries
section.draft-comment: HUB-25 updates to each definition list item below

dlentry.dd:
Counts of golden records and quarantine entries.
The golden records count links to the Golden Records page, which is used to view golden records.
The quarantine entries count is highlighted in purple. The count is omitted for a domain for which there are not any quarantine entries. If present the count links to the Quarantine page, which is used to view and resolve quarantine entries.

The type of bulk processing request is one of the following:
End-date — The request is for the end-dating of golden records.
Purge — The request is for the purging of end-dated golden records.
Send Updates — The request is for the propagation of source record update requests for golden records.

section.title: Paragraphs
section.p: HUB-1676 insertionA repository is a virtual container for master data storage that hosts an individual account’s master data domains — for example, Contact, Employee, Partner, Vendor.

HUB-1676 insertionA repository accepts data updates from sources, matches entities from the different sources to one another and propagates source record update requests specifying create, update and delete operations. An individual repository is hosted in a Hub Cloud.

The offset is applicable to both the range starting and ending times. The default is the offset for the user’s system’s local time zone. This parameter is specified in RFC 822 format, which is five characters: ±HHMM. For example, –0400 is the offset for the US Eastern time zone while daylight saving time is in effect. While this parameter can be omitted from a bookmarked URL specifying a range, if the bookmark is to be shared with users in different time zones, including this parameter ensures those users will have the same view of the data.
The staged entities list automatically refreshes shortly after the completion of the operation to reflect the result. In the meantime you can request a manual Refresh.

HUB-1637 insertion. Note is intentionally embedded in Paragraph because the two go together.Tags are first applied to a domain’s golden records upon the completion of the initial deployment of a version of the domain model containing tag definitions. Tags are reapplied upon completion of each subsequent deployment of the model in which tag definitions are added, modified, or deleted.HUB-1637 insertion.If, during tagging of golden records, a different version of the model is deployed, tagging stops and then restarts upon completion of the new deployment.
HUB-1351/1788 insertionWhen the golden record is restored, a Restore Record update request is propagated for each source entity to which the golden record is linked on the source’s channel.

section.title: Unordered Lists

li.p: mdm_source_id — ID of the batch’s contributing source.
mdm_account_id — ID of the account under which the batch was contributed.
mdm_repository_id — system ID of the repository on which the target domain is hosted.
mdm_universe_id — system ID of the domain.

section.draft-comment: HUB-25 update to all list items HUB-141/142 update to list item QUARANTINED. RECORD_ALREADY_ENDDATED

li.p: COMPLETED.* — entities which, if actually contributed when staged, would not have been quarantined.

COMPLETED.CREATED — entities which, if actually contributed when staged, would have resulted in the creation of a golden record. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Create Record in the Staged Entities page.

COMPLETED.UPDATED — entities which, if actually contributed when staged, would have resulted in the updating of a golden record. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Update Record in the Staged Entities page.

COMPLETED.DELETED — entities which, if actually contributed when staged, would have resulted in the end-dating of a golden record. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Delete Record in the Staged Entities page.

COMPLETED.LINKED — entities which, if actually contributed when staged, would have resulted in the linking of a golden record to the source entity. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Link Record in the Staged Entities page.

COMPLETED.LINKED_WITH_UPDATE — entities which, if actually contributed when staged, would have resulted in the linking of a golden record to the source entity and the updating of that golden record. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Link and Update Record in the Staged Entities page.

COMPLETED.NOOP — entities which, if actually contributed when staged, would not have resulted in the creation, updating, end-dating, or linking of a golden record. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion No Change to Record in the Staged Entities page.

QUARANTINED.* — entities which, if actually contributed when staged, would have been quarantined. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Quarantine and the Quarantine Cause filter criterion All in the Staged Entities page.

QUARANTINED.AMBIGUOUS_MATCH —entities that would have been quarantined due to their matching 10 or more golden records, regardless of links to source records. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Quarantined and the Quarantine Cause filter criterion Ambiguous Match in the Staged Entities page.

QUARANTINED.DUPLICATE_KEY — entities that would have been quarantined because they contain multiple collection items with the same key values. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Quarantined and the Quarantine Cause filter criterion Duplicate Collection Key in the Staged Entities page.

QUARANTINED.ENRICH_ERROR — entities that would have been quarantined due to data quality step failure. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Quarantined and the Quarantine Cause filter criterion Data Quality Error in the Staged Entities page.

QUARANTINED.FIELD_FORMAT_ERROR — entities that would have been quarantined because they contain data not in conformance with either their field type, validation options for that field type specified in the domain model, or with the system 255-character limit for text and Enumeration field values. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Quarantined and the Quarantine Cause filter criterion Field Format Error in the Staged Entities page.

QUARANTINED.INCORPORATE_ERROR — entities causing errors other than unresolvable references during the staging of incorporation. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Quarantined and the Quarantine Cause filter criterion Other Incorporation Error in the Staged Entities page.

QUARANTINED.MATCH_REFERENCE_UNKNOWN — entities that would have been quarantined due to their having a value in a reference field specified for matching in a match rule that does not resolve to a golden record. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Quarantined and the Quarantine Cause filter criterion Reference Matching Error in the Staged Entities page.

QUARANTINED.MULTIPLE_MATCHES — entities that would have been quarantined due to their matching multiple golden records not yet linked to a record in the source. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Quarantined and the Quarantine Cause filter criterion Multiple Matches in the Staged Entities page.

QUARANTINED.PARSE_FAILURE — entities that would have been quarantined due to their failure to structurally conform with the field layout specified in the domain model. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Quarantined and the Quarantine Cause filter criterion Data Integration Error in the Staged Entities page.

QUARANTINED.POSSIBLE_DUPLICATE — entities that would have been quarantined due to their matching golden records that have already been linked to a record in the source. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Quarantined and the Quarantine Cause filter criterion Potential Duplicate in the Staged Entities page.

QUARANTINED.RECORD_ALREADY_ENDDATED — entities that would have been quarantined due to the existence of a link from an end-dated golden record. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Quarantined and the Quarantine Cause filter criterion Record Already End-dated in the Staged Entities page.

QUARANTINED.REFERENCE UNKNOWN — entities that would have been quarantined due to their having unresolvable references, either collection items or fields for which referential integrity for entity contributions is enforced. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Quarantined and the Quarantine Cause filter criterion Unknown Reference Value in the Staged Entities page.

QUARANTINED.REQUIRED_FIELD — entities that would have been quarantined due to their omission of fields specified as required or as key fields for collections in the domain model. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Quarantined and the Quarantine Cause filter criterion Required Field Omitted in the Staged Entities page.

QUARANTINED.REQUIRES_APPROVAL — entities that would have been quarantined due to their satisfying conditions configured for their source requiring the manual approval of new entity contributions. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Quarantined and the Quarantine Cause filter criterion Create Approval Required in the Staged Entities page.

QUARANTINED.REQUIRES_END_DATE_APPROVAL — entities that would have been quarantined due to their sources being configured to require manual approval of contributed entities that would end-date matching golden records. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Quarantined and the Quarantine Cause filter criterion End-date Approval Required in the Staged Entities page.

QUARANTINED.REQUIRES_UPDATE_APPROVAL — entities that would have been quarantined due to their satisfying conditions configured for their source requiring the manual approval of contributed entities that would update matching golden records. This token corresponds to the Entity Result filter criterion Quarantined and the Quarantine Cause filter criterion Update Approval Required in the Staged Entities page.
PAST_HOUR — this token corresponds to the Created Date filter criterion Past Hour in the Staged Entities page.
PAST_24_HOURS — this token corresponds to the Created Date filter criterion Past 24 Hours in the Staged Entities page.
PAST_WEEK — this token corresponds to the Created Date filter criterion Past Week in the Staged Entities page.

li.draft-comment: HUB-975 update, release profiling intentionally omitted
li.p: The aggregate size of the model’s fields, exclusive of the id field, reference fields and repeatable (collection) fields, exceeds 65,331 bytes. The sizes, in bytes, of the field types that affect model size are as follows:

ul.li: Text — 3 × the field’s Maximum Text Length

li.p: For example, consider a model with four Text fields, all with their Maximum Text Length set to 100, two Integer fields, a Date field, and a Time field. The aggregate field size would be 1,214 bytes, calculated as the sum of (4 Text fields × (3 × 100)), (2 Integer fields × 4), and 3 each for the Date and Time fields.

li.draft-comment: HUB-975 insertion, release profiling intentionally omitted
li.p: HUB-1576 unrelated rewording, release profiling intentionally omittedThe size of the database rows in which would internally maintain domain data upon deployment of the model, calculated as the sum of the following, exceeds 8,126 bytes:

ul.li: HUB-1576 update237 bytes of database-mandated overhead
(7 bytes + n)/8, rounded up to the next integer, where n is the number of fields, exclusive of the id field, reference fields, and repeatable (collection) fields

li.p: Field type-specific byte allocations:
HUB-1576 updateFor example, consider a model with four Text fields, two Integer fields, a Date field, and a Time field. The row size would be 417 bytes, calculated as the sum of the following:

ul.li: 178, calculated as (4 Text fields × 41) + (2 Integer fields × 4) + 3 each for the Date and Time fields

section.title: API endpoints
section.p: host is the host name or IP address of the repository and port is the port number of the shared HTTP server as configured in the account’s Atom Management settings.

section.title: Filter parameters for golden record querying APIs
section.p: These are the structures of the supported parameter types:
The order in which filter parameters are specified in <filter> is insignificant.

li.p: <createdDate> sets a filter by the date and time of golden record creation.
<from> sets the range’s starting date and time.
<to> sets the range’s ending date and time.
The format for both <from> and <to> is yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z', where 'T' separates the date and time — for example, 2013-03-01T15:32:00Z.
Omitting <from> filters golden records created before the <to> date/time. Omitting <to> filters golden records created after the <from> date/time.
<updatedDate> sets a filter by the date and time of last golden record update.
<from> sets the range’s starting date and time.
<to> sets the range’s ending date and time.
The format for both <from> and <to> is yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z', where 'T' separates the date and time — for example, 2013-03-01T15:32:00Z.
Omitting <from> filters golden records updated before the <to> date/time. Omitting <to> filters golden records updated after the <from> date/time.
<fieldValue> sets a filter by golden record field value.
The <fieldId> element specifies the field ID.
The <operator> element specifies the operator. The valid operators are dependent upon the field type.
This operator is valid for all types:
EQUALS
These operators are valid for all types except Reference fields and collection (repeatable) or collection item fields of any type:
DOC-1441 correction NOT_EQUALS
IS_NOT_NULL
IS_NULL
These operators are valid only for Text and Long Text fields:
CONTAINS
ENDS_WITH
STARTS_WITH
These operators are valid only for Integer and Float fields:
GREATER_THAN
GREATER_THAN_EQUAL — greater than or equal to
LESS_THAN
LESS_THAN_EQUAL — less than or equal to
This operator is available only for Date, Date/Time, and Time fields:
BETWEEN
This operator is valid only for Enumeration fields:
IS_INVALID — not in the field’s enumerated value list
A <value> element specifies a value.
One <value> element is used with each operator with these exceptions:
BETWEEN — requires two <value> elements for the setting of a range for a Date, Date/Time, or Time field value in the format:
Date/Time — yyyy-MM-dd'T'HH:mm:ss'Z' — for example, 2013-03-01T15:32:00Z
Date — yyyy-MM-dd — for example, 2013-03-01
Time — HH:mm:ss — for example, 15:32:00
EQUALS with an Enumeration field allows multiple <value> elements. A golden record having any one of the specified values is considered to meet the criterion. In other words, the values are “OR’ed”.
IS_INVALID — <value> is not used with this operator.
IS_NOT_NULL — <value> is not used with this operator.
IS_NULL — <value> is not used with this operator.
The valid values for filtering Boolean field values are true and false.

<tags> sets a filter by one or more tags, each of which is specified by <tagName>. This filter is applied such that a golden record having any one of the specified tags is considered to meet the tag criteria. In other words, the tags are “OR’ed”.
<creatingSourceId> sets a filter by a creating source specified by its source ID.
<sourceLink> sets a filter by the presence or absence of links to a source.
The <sourceId> element specifies the source by its ID.
The <linkType> element contains either LINKED, for filtering by the presence of links, or NOT_LINKED, for filtering by the absence of links.

li.note: HUB-1696 insertionIf the universe (domain) has one or more attached sources configured with the option to allow multiple links to golden records, processing time for requests in which the <sourceLink> filter is set may be significantly longer than other requests.

li.p: <unresolvedReference> sets a filter by the presence of unresolved reference field data.
The <fieldId> element specifies a reference field by its ID.
The <sourceId> element contains either a source by its ID or @all, which limits results to golden records for which all source contributions are unresolved.

body.note: A field’s ID can be found in the model page’s Fields tab in . A source’s ID can be found in the Sources page in .

li.p: created as a result of an entity submission from the source NetSuite (ID: NS)
linked to the source Salesforce (ID: SFDC)
having either or both of the tags Area Code 311 and Mid-Atlantic
having a website field value ending with “.biz”
last updated during the period starting August 17, 2016 and ending September 2, 2016

body.note: If a request includes both <recordId> elements and <filter>, <filter> is disregarded.

plentry.pd: (multiple-channel sources only) ID of the channel
ID of the transaction, which can be obtained from a Query Quarantine Entries operation.
ID of the Propagate Channel Updates request. This ID is obtained from the response body for that request.

section.title: API responses

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The authenticating user does not have the API Access and MDM - Repository Management privileges required for this operation. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The authenticated user does not have access rights to this functionality</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The authenticating user does not have the API Access and MDM - View Repositories privileges required for this operation. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The authenticated user does not have access rights to this functionality</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The authenticating user does not have the API Access and MDM - View Models privileges required for this operation. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The authenticated user does not have access rights to this functionality</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The authenticating user does not have the API Access and MDM - Edit Models privileges required for this operation. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The authenticated user does not have access rights to this functionality</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The authenticating user does not have the API Access privilege and either the MDM - View Data privilege or the View Records entitlement required for this operation. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The authenticated user does not have access rights to this functionality</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The authenticating user does not have the API Access and MDM - Source Management privileges required for this operation. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The authenticated user does not have access rights to this functionality</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The authenticating user does not have the API Access and MDM - Source Attachment privileges required for this operation. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The authenticated user does not have access rights to this functionality</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The authenticating user does not have the API Access and MDM - Model Deployment privileges required for this operation. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The authenticated user does not have access rights to this functionality</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The authenticating user does not have the API Access privilege and the Delete Quarantine entitlement required for this operation. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The authenticated user does not have access rights to this functionality</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The authenticating user does not have the API Access privilege and the Approve Creates and Approve Updates entitlements required for this operation. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The authenticated user does not have access rights to this functionality</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The authenticating user does not have the API Access privilege and the Match Quarantine entitlement required for this operation. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The authenticated user does not have access rights to this functionality</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) repositoryID does not identify a repository under the specified account. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>Could not find containerAccount for container id dbe797ff-6d6f-44e9-acd9-d77494a44b15 and account id account-123456</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The universeID parameter value contains only space characters. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The given universe id is blank.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) modelID is not a valid GUID and is therefore an invalid component ID. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>1 is not a valid component ID.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) modelID does not identify a model in the specified account. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>A model with ID 851a6a64-6a88-4916-a5b7-d6a974d54318 does not exist.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The modelID and version parameter combination does not identify a model version in the specified account. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>A component with ID 851a6a64-6a88-4916-a5b7-d6a974d54318 and version 100 does not exist.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) A draft version of a model with ID modelID does not exist. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The model does not currently have a Draft version</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The specified model name is invalid due to its length. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>Model creation failed due to a null or invalid model name. The name must have at least 2 characters and no more than 40.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) universeID does not identify a universe deployed to the repository specified by repositoryID under the specified account. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>universe is not deployed to the repository</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) universeID does not identify a universe deployed to the repository specified by repositoryID under the specified account. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>Universe '851a6a64-6a88-4916-a5b7-d6a974d54318' is not deployed to repository 'dbe797ff-6d6f-44e9-acd9-d77494a44b15'.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) sourceId does not identify a source that exists in the specified account. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>A source with ID 'WD' does not exist in this account.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The request does not specify a staging area ID. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The given staging id is blank.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) A staging area with the specified ID does not exist for the specified source. This error has additional possible causes: It can signify that sourceID does not identify a source attached to the specified universe or universeID does not identify a universe hosted in the specified repository. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>There is no staging area with staging area ID '456789ab-cdef-0123-4567-89abcdef0123' for the specified source.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The request does not contain a properly-formatted StagingActionRequest object. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>Unable to read message body. Please make sure the XML structure and namespace are correct.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The <batch> element’s src attribute value specifies a valid contributing source but the XML document contains invalid markup. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>When trying to parse a batch update for universe with id '851a6a64-6a88-4916-a5b7-d6a974d54318'.</message> <message>Unexpected EOF; was expecting a close tag for element <batch> at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,16]</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The request body is empty. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>When trying to parse a batch update for universe with id '851a6a64-6a88-4916-a5b7-d6a974d54318'.</message> <message>Unexpected EOF in prolog at [row,col {unknown-source}]: [1,0]</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The request body does not start with a <batch> tag. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>An update batch for universe with id '851a6a64-6a88-4916-a5b7-d6a974d54318' could not be processed because it starts with a 'foo' tag instead of with a 'batch' tag.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The <batch> element does not have a populated src attribute. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>An update batch for universe with id '851a6a64-6a88-4916-a5b7-d6a974d54318' does not contain a source ('src') attribute.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The update identified by updateID has already been acknowledged. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The update with id '3' in channel with id '4ff6d6ff-577e-4f64-ae45-3b6450dd53ce' has already been acknowledged.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) channelID does not identify a channel for which Initial Load is complete. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The channel '4ff6d6ff-577e-4f64-ae45-3b6450dd53ce' for source 'QB' in universe 'a28c2bc9-e6c7-4aa2-8a7e-a2e77ca9b887' is CREATED but needs to be STRAPPED before update requests are allowed.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The recordID parameter value contains only space characters. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The given record id is blank.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) requestID is not a an integer and is therefore invalid. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>'abc' is not a valid request ID.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) A <fieldId> element is specified that is not in the deployed version of the universe’s model. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>This 'fieldId', 'FOUNDER', is not in the model 'VENDOR'.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) A filter criterion contains a <fieldValue> element that does not contain a child <fieldId> element. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>Each 'fieldValue' element must contain one 'fieldId' element.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) A filter criterion contains a <fieldValue> element that does not contain a child <operator> element. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>Each 'fieldValue' element must contain one 'operator' element; fieldId = 'PHONE'.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) A filter criterion specifies a field of a type for which the specified operation is not supported. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>Field 'AGE' of type 'INTEGER' does not support operation 'BETWEEN'; supported operations: 'EQUALS, NOT_EQUALS, LESS_THAN, LESS_THAN_EQUAL, GREATER_THAN, GREATER_THAN_EQUAL, IS_NOT_NULL, IS_NULL'.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) A filter criterion specifies multiple values for a field type and operator combination for which multiple values are not valid. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>This field-type / operator, 'INTEGER' / 'EQUALS', does not accept multiple values; fieldId = 'AGE'.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) A filter criterion incorrectly specifies a time range because less than or more than two <value> elements are specified. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The BETWEEN operator takes exactly 2 values; fieldId = 'BIRTH_DATE', operator = 'BETWEEN'.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) A filter criterion specifying an operator for which a <value> element(s) are required omits that element. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>This operator requires a 'value' element: fieldId = 'AGE'; operator = 'EQUALS'.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) A filter criterion specifying an operator for which the <value> element is invalid includes that element. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The operation 'IS_NULL' does not allow any 'value' elements: fieldId = 'AGE'.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) A filter criterion specifies an empty <value> element. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>Each value must be non-blank: fieldId = 'AGE'; operation = 'EQUALS'.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) A <sourceLink> filter criterion omits one of the required child elements. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>One of the 'sourceLink' elements is missing: 'linkType'.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) A <sourceLink> filter criterion omits both required child elements. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>Both of the 'sourceLink' elements is missing: 'sourceId', 'linkType'.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The child <linkType> element in a <sourceLink> filter criterion does not contain either LINKED or NOT_LINKED. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>Source link type must be one of { 'LINKED, NOT_LINKED' }</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The <creatingSourceId> element, which is used to set a filter by creating source, is present but empty. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The 'creatingSourceId' cannot be blank when the element is present.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) An <unresolvedReference> filter criterion omits one of the required child elements. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>One of the 'unresolvedReference' elements is missing: 'sourceId'.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) The field specified in an <unresolvedReference> filter criterion is not a Reference field. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The field type for an 'unresolvedReference' condition must be REFERENCE: fieldId = 'AGE'.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) An <unresolvedReference> filter criterion omits both required child elements. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>Both of the 'unresolvedReference' elements are required: "fieldId', 'sourceId'.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) A <tags> filter criterion specifies a tag that is not in the deployed version of the universe’s model. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The tagName 'Area Code 311' is not defined in this universe.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) A <tags> filter criterion is specified but there are no tags in the deployed version of the universe’s model. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>There are no tags defined in this universe.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) A Date/Time field value specified in a filter criterion is incorrectly formatted. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>This date-time has a bad value in it or is not formatted correctly (YYYY-MM-DDT00:00:00Z): '02013-03-01T15:32:00Z'; fieldId = 'LAST_CONTACT'.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) A Date field value specified in a filter criterion is incorrectly formatted. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>This date has a bad value in it or is not formatted correctly (YYYY-MM-DD): '2013-3-1'; fieldId = 'BIRTHDATE'.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) A Time field value specified in a filter criterion is incorrectly formatted. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>This time has a bad value in it or is not formatted correctly (00:00:00): '3:32pm'; fieldId = 'ARRIVING'.</message> </error>

li.p: 403 (Forbidden) Access to this API endpoint is not enabled for this account. The response body is empty.
403 (Forbidden) Authentication failure. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <UserMessage id="error.user.login" type="error"> <Data>Incorrect user name and password combination.</Data> </UserMessage>

li.p: 403 (Forbidden) One or more path parameter values are omitted. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <UserMessage id="error.user.login" type="error"> <Data>Incorrect user name and password combination.</Data> </UserMessage>

li.p: 403 (Forbidden) accountID does not identify an account accessible to the authenticating user. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <UserMessage id="error.user.login" type="error"> <Data>Incorrect user name and password combination.</Data> </UserMessage>

li.p: 404 (Not Found) universeID does not identify a universe hosted in the specified repository. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>A universe with id 'ac11cc59-c77a-4afe-8c92-ed86a7daabec' does not exist.</message> </error>

li.p: 404 (Not Found) universeID does not identify a universe under the authenticated account. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>A universe with id 'ac11cc59-c77a-4afe-8c92-ed86a7daabec' does not exist.</message> <message>Universe definition with id 'ac11cc59-c77a-4afe-8c92-ed86a7daabec' could not be loaded from plugin component directory 'plugins/mdm/bundles/ac11cc59-c77a-4afe-8c92-ed86a7daabec'.</message> </error>

li.p: 404 (Not Found) recordID does not identify an active or end-dated record in the specified universe that the authenticating user is entitled to view. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>A record with id '1' does not exist.</message> </error>

li.p: 404 (Not Found) recordID does not identify an active or end-dated golden record in the specified universe. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <errors> <error>A record with id '1' does not exist.</error> </errors>

li.p: 404 (Not Found) sourceID does not identify a source attached to the specified universe. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>Source with code 'FOO' does not exist under universe '851a6a64-6a88-4916-a5b7-d6a974d54318'.</message> </error>

li.p: 404 (Not Found) The <batch> element’s src attribute value does not specify a source attached to the specified universe. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>Source with code 'FOO' does not exist for universe with id '31cb0f62-b239-4d96-b112-bc4fafea362d'.</message> </error>

li.p: 400 (Bad Request) A source with the specified ID is not attached to the specified universe. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The source with ID 'NS' is not attached to the specified universe.</message> </error>

li.p: 404 (Not Found) stagingAreaId does not identify a staging area for a source in the specified universe. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>A staging area with id SFStaging was not found in universe: ac11cc59-c77a-4afe-8c92-ed86a7daabec</message> </error>

li.p: 404 (Not Found) The staging area ID specified in the request does not identify a staging area for the specified source in the specified universe. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>A staging area with id SFStaging was not found in universe: ac11cc59-c77a-4afe-8c92-ed86a7daabec</message> </error>

li.p: 404 (Not Found) channelID does not identify a channel for the specified source. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>Channel with id '4ff6d6ff-577e-4f64-ae45-3b6450dd53ce' for source 'FOO' does not exist under universe '851a6a64-6a88-4916-a5b7-d6a974d54318'.</message> </error>

li.p: 404 (Not Found) updateID does not identify a batch of source record update requests for the specified channel. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>A batch with id 'foo' does not exist.</message> </error>

li.p: 404 (Not Found) entityID does not identify a quarantine entry for the specified source. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>The entity '1' from source 'NS' for universe 'ac11cc59-c77a-4afe-8c92-ed86a7daabec' is not quarantined.</message> </error>

li.p: 404 (Not Found) transactionID does not identify a quarantine entry in the specified universe. Sample response body:
li.codeblock: <error> <message>A quarantined entity version with id '42dbadd8-d226-4c4d-abe3-1dae8636e77a' does not exist.</message> </error>

section.note: This error response is applicable only to the Update Model operation.
section.p: Markup exception: Note is intentionally embedded in paragraph to streamline content referencingFollowing are general error responses. Model validation error responses are specific to individual model components: fields, sources, data quality steps, record title format, match rules, and tags, as well as to business rules used in source, data quality step, and tag definitions.Validation continues until the entire XML representation of the model is processed. All validation errors are returned in the response.
